subject: RE: [junit] @Before vs constructor
msgSnippet: I believe the second ALWAYS line has a before where after was intended. Charlie ...
messageBody:
I believe the second ALWAYS line has a "before" where
"after" was intended.

Charlie

> >> Dear all,
> >>
> >> It seems that for evey case, a new instance is constructed.
> >>
> >> If this is by design, then no need for '@Before', because
> the before
> >> fixure code can be put in the constructor.
> >
> > A @Before method is guaranteed to run *just* before the
> test is run.
> > The constructor isn't, as far as I know.
>
